hackathon-description-text: MinneHack, the University of Minnesota's largest software competition event hosted by the UMN chapter of The Association for Computing Machinery.
hackathon-eligibility: Teams will consist of up to 4 human students
hackathon-rules: Judging will be based on creativity, presentation, execution, and prompt.  Prompt points will be determined independently for each prize category.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Oculus Rift & Leap Motion Controller for each team member
AR Parrot Drone for each team member
Waterproof Bluetooth Speaker for each team member

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Any participants that use the provided data set will qualify for this prize.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: $250 gift certificate for MicroCenter for each team member

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Best use of Watson IoT platform on IBM Bluemix
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Apple iWatch for each team member

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=300 Washington Ave SE, Minneapolis, MN 55455, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How creative, innovative, and original is the project?
How well was the project executed?
How well was the project presented?
How well did the project follow the main prompt, improving in home health care?

hackathon-location-address: 300 Washington Ave SE, Minneapolis, MN 55455, USA
hackathon-description-header: Twin Cities Hackthon hosted at the University of Minnesota!
